  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Chief Operating Officer",
  "description": "Trinity Financials is a limited liability company duly incorporated in Nigeria under the 2002 Companies and Allied Matters Act. licensed and supervised by the Central Bank of Nigeria as a full-fledged Financial Service Firm.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Reports to: Chief Executive officer
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a business-oriented and result-driven chief operating officer (COO) to oversee the company&rsquo;s ongoing operation and drive strategic initiatives that align with business goals.
	The COO will play a crucial role in scaling the organization, enhancing efficiency, and implementing operational excellence across the business development departments.
	The candidate must be currently working on the island within a financial institution.
	Candidates with experience in marketing, an MBA, or a master&rsquo;s degree will have an added advantage given the sector&rsquo;s fast-paced, regulatory, and technology-driven nature.


Responsibilities


	Work closely with the CEO and executive team to develop and implement the company&rsquo;s strategic goals and objectives.
	Drive business expansion strategies. Lead, mentor and motivate teams
	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track operational effectiveness and recommend improvement.
	Translate business strategy into operational plans and performance goals.
	Oversee the execution of business strategies across all departments.
	Direct and manage day-to-day operations to ensure efficiency and productivity.
	Develop and implement operational policies, procedures, and systems.
	Ensure all departments (e.g., HR, Finance, Production, Sales, and Customer Service) work together effectively toward organizational goals.
	Collaborate with the CFO to prepare budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.
	Monitor financial performance and ensure cost-effective operations.
	Identify areas for financial improvement and implement cost-saving initiatives.
	Establish performance metrics and monitor organizational performance against set targets.
	Ensure departments achieve their KPIs and deliver high-quality outcomes.
	Lead efforts to continuously improve productivity, quality, and service delivery.
	Provide regular operational updates to the CEO and Board of Directors.
	Maintain transparent communication across all levels of the organization.
	Represent the company in external meetings and partnerships when required.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Must have a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, finance, or related field
	10+ years of Managerial position, strategic operations or senior leadership experience
	An MBA or master&rsquo;s degree within this field will be preferred
	Proven track records of scaling organizations and leading cross-functional teams.
	Strong financial acumen and experience with budgeting, forecasting, marketing, and performance management.
	Excellent marketing, leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.
	Experience within a fintech industry will be preferred.
	The candidate must have a good understanding of financial regulations, lending, blockchain, digital payment, or related sectors.


Salary
N500,000 - N800,000 Monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;trinityfinancialng01@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Chief Operating Officer Job at Trinity Finance Limited




        
    

        
        Trinity Financials is a limited liability company duly incorporated in Nigeria under the 2002 Companies and Allied Matters Act. licensed and supervised by the Central Bank of Nigeria as a full-fledged Financial Service Firm.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Reports to: Chief Executive officer
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a business-oriented and result-driven chief operating officer (COO) to oversee the company’s ongoing operation and drive strategic initiatives that align with business goals.
	The COO will play a crucial role in scaling the organization, enhancing efficiency, and implementing operational excellence across the business development departments.
	The candidate must be currently working on the island within a financial institution.
	Candidates with experience in marketing, an MBA, or a master’s degree will have an added advantage given the sector’s fast-paced, regulatory, and technology-driven nature.


Responsibilities


	Work closely with the CEO and executive team to develop and implement the company’s strategic goals and objectives.
	Drive business expansion strategies. Lead, mentor and motivate teams
	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track operational effectiveness and recommend improvement.
	Translate business strategy into operational plans and performance goals.
	Oversee the execution of business strategies across all departments.
	Direct and manage day-to-day operations to ensure efficiency and productivity.
	Develop and implement operational policies, procedures, and systems.
	Ensure all departments (e.g., HR, Finance, Production, Sales, and Customer Service) work together effectively toward organizational goals.
	Collaborate with the CFO to prepare budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.
	Monitor financial performance and ensure cost-effective operations.
	Identify areas for financial improvement and implement cost-saving initiatives.
	Establish performance metrics and monitor organizational performance against set targets.
	Ensure departments achieve their KPIs and deliver high-quality outcomes.
	Lead efforts to continuously improve productivity, quality, and service delivery.
	Provide regular operational updates to the CEO and Board of Directors.
	Maintain transparent communication across all levels of the organization.
	Represent the company in external meetings and partnerships when required.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, finance, or related field
	10+ years of Managerial position, strategic operations or senior leadership experience
	An MBA or master’s degree within this field will be preferred
	Proven track records of scaling organizations and leading cross-functional teams.
	Strong financial acumen and experience with budgeting, forecasting, marketing, and performance management.
	Excellent marketing, leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.
	Experience within a fintech industry will be preferred.
	The candidate must have a good understanding of financial regulations, lending, blockchain, digital payment, or related sectors.


Salary
N500,000 - N800,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: trinityfinancialng01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
